alert.note: Alert for Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 10:39AM CDT until May 13 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Oklahoma and east central Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Lincoln and Pottawatomie. In east central Oklahoma, Seminole. * WHEN...Until 145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1038 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - another inch of rainfall is expected over the next hour - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prague, Johnson and Centerview. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
